channel.title: NES Suggestions
channel.description:
I bought an NES with Super Mario Bros. yesterday and was wondering if anyone could suggest some other good games?
I already have my own list working (SMB 3 and Zelda to name a couple), but any suggestions are appreciated.

item.title: NES Suggestions
item.dc:creator: bigfan421
item.description:
Metal Gear

Read full topic

item.title: NES Suggestions
item.dc:creator: geekofalltrades
item.description:
Aaaahhhh, wait… it was SNES wasn’t it. My bad. Like I said, it’s been like 16 years.

Read full topic

item.title: NES Suggestions
item.dc:creator: robot_deodorant
item.description:
Narfin:

…Oh, and Duck Hunt if you manage to find the zapper.

I have Duck Hunt and a Zapper, my problem is that the Zapper barely works on my HDTV and that I need to connect my NES to my CRT TV as soon as possible.

Executor:

Seriously, the first Turtles game is a nigh-unplayable POS. It’s pretty telling when a Game Genie is practically required to finish the damn thing.

…I liked that game… Actually that reminds me that I need to get a Game Genie.

geekofalltrades:

I used to love Mighty Morphin Power Rangers on NES. Of course, it’s easily been fifteen or sixteen years since I played it, and it could be that the novelty of Power Rangers (which I loved when I was five-ish) and NES (as I wasn’t allowed to have consoles growing up) are overpowering my impression of an ultimately shitty game.

They made a Power Rangers game for NES?? That’s a must-have, no matter how shitty (if it does exist).

Read full topic

item.title: NES Suggestions
item.dc:creator: Saftle
item.description:
The most underrated games that most people have never heard of, I would say are Little Samson and Trog. Little Samson for it’s creative gameplay that is even fun for today’s standards, and Trog is fun on the higher levels with 2 players.

Read full topic

item.title: NES Suggestions
item.dc:creator: DJ_Autom8
item.description:
DUCKTALES TIMES 10,000! It was rated as high as SMB3!!! Also, Kirby was good, and I really liked this hard to find game Gyruss. It had a unique system, where you rotated around the screen as things are coming toward you. Sorta like galaga, but way better enemies, music, and control system.
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=oitm9y32Vhw
And I’m out for the next few months.

Read full topic

Seriously, the first Turtles game is a nigh-unplayable POS. It’s pretty telling when a Game Genie is practically required to finish the damn thing.

item.description:

Here is a video with the beginning of the game. Mind the audio only coming out of the left speaker.

item.title: NES Suggestions
item.dc:creator: Narfin
item.description:
Partly copypasta from my post in a previous thread:

-Micro Machines (One of my all-time favorite games)
-Rampage (really fun with a friend, kinda boring without)
-Snake, Rattle & Roll (probably my favorite NES game of all time)
-Contra
-Of course Super Mario Brothers (1 & 3)
-Tecmo Super Bowl (With a friend only)
-Chip 'N Dale Rescue Rangers
-City Connection (sort of, if you’re bored)
-Spot (good time waster with friends)

Oh, and Duck Hunt if you manage to find the zapper.

Read full topic

item.title: NES Suggestions
item.dc:creator: Asharil
item.description:
Executor:

What the hell, no love for Kirby’s Adventure? It’s one of the best (and best-looking, it even had parallax scrolling) games for the NES.

How could I have forgotten about that game. I freakin’ loved it!

Read full topic

item.title: NES Suggestions
item.dc:creator: robot_deodorant
item.description:
ac3d:

Just curious, what type of TV are you using?

Right now it’s connected to a very large HDTV in my living room until my game room is completed. I have a roughly 30-inch CRT waiting for it.

Asharil:

I’m now wondering what NES games look like on a HD screen.

Shit.

EDIT: Wanted to thank you guys for the continuing suggestions. I’ve been out on family vacation. But these have been useful!

Read full topic

Super Mario Kart SNES actually looks pretty crap on my HD screen. Might be due to the SuperFX graphics.

item.title: NES Suggestions
item.dc:creator: Asharil
item.description:
No love for Megaman 2?

Any (all!) Ducktales games, River City Ransom/Streetgangs, any SMB game, Gremlins 2, the Zelda’s, Mission Impossible, Rollergames (pretty obscure, but good!), TMNT 2: Arcade Game, TMNT 3: Manhattan Project, New Ghostbusters II (note the new, that’s important!).

Read full topic

item.title: NES Suggestions
item.dc:creator: Diabeetus
item.description:
The Goonies 2. I don’t know how it is regarded now, but back then it was really expansive and a major challenge. https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=h174ElaRlK0

Flatline:

Meh, Rampage? Man that game got tedious quickly.

Well yeah, it probably would be now-a-days, but when I was 6 or 7 is was top notch entertainment for hours at a time, lol.

item.title: NES Suggestions
item.dc:creator: robot_deodorant
item.description:
Thanks guys! I’ll be checking out all of these suggestions. I’m up for pretty much any type of game as long as it’s fun.

beejoo:

also watch the Angry Video Game Nerd for games to stay away from

haha… yes, I was! That guy is hilarious. Also, I might have bought Ghostbusters if I wasn’t reminded how awful a game it was.

…then again, I still may buy it out of nostalgia…

Read full topic
